App description:
In Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes, one player is trapped in a virtual room with a ticking time bomb they must defuse. The other players are the Experts who must give the instructions to defuse the bomb by deciphering the information found in the Bomb Defusal Manual. But theres a catch: the Experts cant see the bomb, so everyone will need to talk it out fast!
 
Features:
 Challenging puzzles  Test the limits of your communication skills and friendships?
 A different bomb every time  Procedurally generated puzzles keep the action fresh.
 Local multiplayer party game  A great way to experience VR with all of your friends!
 Only one copy of the game needed  If you can talk to the bomb Defuser, you can be their Expert. Try using your favorite voice chat service to play remotely.
 Requires 2 or more players  Bomb defusing is a team endeavor. Going solo is not an option!
 
Requires free Bomb Defusal Manual available at www.bombmanual.com

MasterDecoySGJun 24 at 11:54 PM
Excellent game if you only own 1 headset

Pros:
Excellent theme - The games theme shows through at every level of the experience, fromthe omnipresent dread of ever growing panic as the timer clicks down, to the frustration of ineptitude while you attempt to communicate clearly as fast as possible.

Engaging: even though only one player has the headset, it's genuinely fun to play as either role. There is no down time for any of the players as your always either asking questions, frantically trying to find the correct page or scrutinizing the bomb for minor details

Great tutorial - the tutorial levels (basically the non random levels) do a great job of slowly ramping up the difficulty while introducing new module's concurrently so you don't get overwhelmed by information overload


Cons:
Needs 2 players minimum - I understand that this is a social game, but if you don't have any friends to play with, you cannot play this game.

Requires clear communication - once again, I understand that this is a social game, but if you suffer from communication difficulties (say a stutter, Tourettes ect) you will struggle with this game whether your the defuser or the expert and there is no getting around that.


Overall:
I purchased this game for a game night I was hosting, some of the players where very new to vr and found the controls a little difficult to get the hang of, but everyone had a great time regardless.

My wife and I have since spent a few date nights taking turns defusing bombs.

The game is brilliant if it's what your looking for, just make sure it's the game your looking for.

The concept of this game is amazing and works perfectly for the portable Quest.

All in all a fun local multiplayer game that you can keep coming back to and is a blast to play with others that know nothing about it.
